trans-unit.source: Excel add-in for Machine Learning web services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Excel add-in for Machine Learning web services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure Machine Learning web services directly in Excel without writing any code.
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure Machine Learning web services directly in Excel without writing any code.

trans-unit.source: Excel Add-in for Azure Machine Learning web services
trans-unit.target: Excel Add-in for Azure Machine Learning web services

trans-unit.source: Excel makes it easy to call web services directly without the need to write any code.
trans-unit.target: Excel makes it easy to call web services directly without the need to write any code.

trans-unit.source: Steps to Use an Existing Web Service in the Workbook
trans-unit.target: Steps to Use an Existing Web Service in the Workbook

trans-unit.source: Open the [sample Excel file](http://aka.ms/amlexcel-sample-2), which contains the Excel add-in and data about passengers on the Titanic.
trans-unit.target: Open the [sample Excel file](http://aka.ms/amlexcel-sample-2), which contains the Excel add-in and data about passengers on the Titanic.

trans-unit.source: Choose the web service by clicking it - "Titanic Survivor Predictor (Excel Add-in Sample) [Score]" in this example.
trans-unit.target: Choose the web service by clicking it - "Titanic Survivor Predictor (Excel Add-in Sample) [Score]" in this example.

trans-unit.source: Select web service
trans-unit.target: Select web service

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the **Predict** section.
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the **Predict** section.

trans-unit.source: This workbook already contains sample data, but for a blank workbook you may also select a cell in Excel and click **Use sample data**.
trans-unit.target: This workbook already contains sample data, but for a blank workbook you may also select a cell in Excel and click **Use sample data**.

trans-unit.source: Select the data with headers and click the input data range icon.
trans-unit.target: Select the data with headers and click the input data range icon.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the "My data has headers" box is checked.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the "My data has headers" box is checked.

trans-unit.source: Under **Output**, enter the cell number where you want the output to be, e.g. "H1" here.
trans-unit.target: Under **Output**, enter the cell number where you want the output to be, e.g. "H1" here.

trans-unit.source: Click **Predict**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Predict**.

trans-unit.source: Predict section
trans-unit.target: Predict section

trans-unit.source: Steps to Add a New Web Service
trans-unit.target: Steps to Add a New Web Service

trans-unit.source: Publish a web service ([this page](machine-learning-walkthrough-5-publish-web-service.md) explains how to do it) or use an existing web service.
trans-unit.target: Publish a web service ([this page](machine-learning-walkthrough-5-publish-web-service.md) explains how to do it) or use an existing web service.

trans-unit.source: In Excel, go to the **Web Services** section (if you are in the **Predict** section, click the back arrow to go to the list of web services).
trans-unit.target: In Excel, go to the **Web Services** section (if you are in the **Predict** section, click the back arrow to go to the list of web services).

trans-unit.source: Go to web service selection
trans-unit.target: Go to web service selection

trans-unit.source: Click **Add Web Service**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add Web Service**.

trans-unit.source: In Machine Learning Studio, click the **WEB SERVICES** section in the left pane, and then select the web service.
trans-unit.target: In Machine Learning Studio, click the **WEB SERVICES** section in the left pane, and then select the web service.

trans-unit.source: Studio select web service
trans-unit.target: Studio select web service

trans-unit.source: Copy the API key for the web service.
trans-unit.target: Copy the API key for the web service.

trans-unit.source: Studio API key
trans-unit.target: Studio API key

trans-unit.source: Paste the API key into the Excel add-in text box labeled **API key**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the API key into the Excel add-in text box labeled **API key**.

trans-unit.source: On the **DASHBOARD** tab for the web service, click the **REQUEST/RESPONSE** link.
trans-unit.target: On the **DASHBOARD** tab for the web service, click the **REQUEST/RESPONSE** link.

trans-unit.source: Look for the **OData Endpoint Address** section.
trans-unit.target: Look for the **OData Endpoint Address** section.

trans-unit.source: Copy the URL and paste that into the text box labeled **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy the URL and paste that into the text box labeled **URL**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: URL and API key
trans-unit.target: URL and API key

trans-unit.source: To use the web service, follow the directions above, "Steps to Use an Existing Web Service".
trans-unit.target: To use the web service, follow the directions above, "Steps to Use an Existing Web Service".

trans-unit.source: Sharing Your Workbook
trans-unit.target: Sharing Your Workbook

trans-unit.source: If you save your workbook, then the API keys for the web services you have added will also be saved.
trans-unit.target: If you save your workbook, then the API keys for the web services you have added will also be saved.

trans-unit.source: That means you should only share the workbook with individuals you trust.
trans-unit.target: That means you should only share the workbook with individuals you trust.

trans-unit.source: Ask any questions below or on our [forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=403669&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: Ask any questions below or on our [forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=403669&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
